title: Nudge Theory: Invisible Persuasion
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Nudge Theory: Invisible Persuasion.

hook.text: Putting fruit at eye level in a cafeteria makes people eat more fruit. No one noticed. That's a nudge.

buildup.text: Richard Thaler and Cass Sunstein's 'nudge theory' shows that small design changes alter behavior dramatically.

climax.text: Nudges raise ethical questions: is it persuasion or manipulation when people don't know they're being influenced?

punchline.text: The best persuasion is the kind you never notice.

quiz.question: What is a 'nudge' according to Thaler and Sunstein?
